Linguistic analysis: The expert may have analyzed the language used in the claim to determine if it is consistent with typical news reporting or if there are any indications of exaggeration or fabrication.
Investigation of the tunnel: The expert may have examined the physical evidence of a tunnel dug from the home to the pub to verify its existence and determine if it was indeed used for nightly visits.
Witness interviews: The expert may have interviewed the claimant's wife, neighbors, or other individuals who could provide information or evidence supporting or refuting the claim.
Surveillance footage or records: The expert may have reviewed any available surveillance footage or records from the pub or the claimant's home to determine if there is evidence of the claimant regularly visiting the pub while his wife slept.
